titles.title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to expand the expensing of environmental remediation costs.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary: 7/22/2003--Introduced. Amends the Internal Revenue Code to: (1) make permanent provisions allowing the expensing of environmental remediation costs; (2) revise the definition of "qualified contaminated site" to include toxic as well as hazardous substances; (3) include within the definition of "hazardous or toxic substances" extremely hazardous substances, as defined by Federal law, and petroleum contaminants; and (4) eliminate the recapture of the expensing deduction upon the sale of environmental remediation property.
